KA.AQWE.content: will a law bring enlightenment? > PUBLIC vs. PRIVATE: private is where an official obeys a law and does not apply reason > thoughts against a law do not disrupt the law, one is still dutiful
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: will a law bring enlightenment? > PUBLIC vs. PRIVATE: private is where an official obeys a law and does not apply reason > thoughts against a law do not disrupt the law, one is still dutiful

KA.AQWE.content: a priest is not free, executing someone else’s mandate, if he followed his reason he might after to quit
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: a priest is not free, executing someone else’s mandate, if he followed his reason he might after to quit

KA.AQWE.content: men raise (arbeiten) themselves out of backwardness (Rohigkeit) [progression] > enlightenment: man’s release from self-incurred minority, primarily in matters of religion > a ruler knows there is no public danger to permit public use of reason to critique legislation > he who has a well-disciplined army, should not fear these specters (Schatten) of reason: argue as much as you want and about whatever you want but obey! [freedom of spirit of people w/ impassable limits] > NATURE has cherished the germ (Keim) of the inclination and need for free thought: man has dignity (Würde) more than a machine
KA.AQWE.linkedContent: men raise (arbeiten) themselves out of backwardness (Rohigkeit) [progression] > enlightenment: man’s release from self-incurred minority, primarily in matters of religion > a ruler knows there is no public danger to permit public use of reason to critique legislation > he who has a well-disciplined army, should not fear these specters (Schatten) of reason: argue as much as you want and about whatever you want but obey! [freedom of spirit of people w/ impassable limits] > NATURE has cherished the germ (Keim) of the inclination and need for free thought: man has dignity (Würde) more than a machine

KA.IUHCI.content: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has give man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: nature intends man beyond nature: nature does not do things superfluously > nature has give man the capacity not to follow inclination or instinct but to produce it out of himself [is this a paradox?] > man’s kindness of will achieved by man’s own work > “nature intended that man should owe it all to himself”

KA.IUHCI.content: we do not know how things are arranged w/ inhabitants on other planets > only the species, not the individual (on earth) can achieve his/her destiny
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: we do not know how things are arranged w/ inhabitants on other planets > only the species, not the individual (on earth) can achieve his/her destiny

KA.IUHCI.content: general premise that the world is constituted as a system [presupposition] > even feeble traces (schwachen Spuren) of this state become very important > at least there is some maintenance if not progress
KA.IUHCI.linkedContent: general premise that the world is constituted as a system [presupposition] > even feeble traces (schwachen Spuren) of this state become very important > at least there is some maintenance if not progress

KA.EP.content: why theory won’t hurt the State (impractical ideas can bring no danger to the state) > eternal peace not derived from experience > “saving clause” [Kant feels protected from censorship]
KA.EP.linkedContent: why theory won’t hurt the State (impractical ideas can bring no danger to the state) > eternal peace not derived from experience > “saving clause” [Kant feels protected from censorship]

KA.EP.content: eternal peace is a pleonasm: truce is not peace > soil is a possession (not the state): possession = patrimonium [father]
KA.EP.linkedContent: eternal peace is a pleonasm: truce is not peace > soil is a possession (not the state): possession = patrimonium [father]

KA.EP.content: laws permit delay but not delay ’til doomsday [transvaluation of delay to never] > peace must be founded
KA.EP.linkedContent: laws permit delay but not delay ’til doomsday [transvaluation of delay to never] > peace must be founded

KA.EP.content: all forms of government that are not representative are despotic > democracy always a despotism [?] [p. 444]: all want to be ruler
KA.EP.linkedContent: all forms of government that are not representative are despotic > democracy always a despotism [?] [p. 444]: all want to be ruler

KA.EP.content: war and its success does not decide what is law and what is right [no force of law?] > reason higher than war
KA.EP.linkedContent: war and its success does not decide what is law and what is right [no force of law?] > reason higher than war

KA.EP.content: “The Cosmopolitan or World Law shall be limited to conditions of universal hospitality” [hospitality of law] > right to visit but not become a permanent guest: “no man has a greater fundamental right to occupy a particular spot than any other”
KA.EP.linkedContent: “The Cosmopolitan or World Law shall be limited to conditions of universal hospitality” [hospitality of law] > right to visit but not become a permanent guest: “no man has a greater fundamental right to occupy a particular spot than any other”

KA.EP.content: theory only in conflict w/ practice if practice denies that morals exist
KA.EP.linkedContent: theory only in conflict w/ practice if practice denies that morals exist

KA.EP.content: there is a compatibility btwn morals and law > Kant can imagine a moral politician but not a political moralist
KA.EP.linkedContent: there is a compatibility btwn morals and law > Kant can imagine a moral politician but not a political moralist

KA.EP.content: despots only embarrassed when their political maxims fail, not if they are revealed
KA.EP.linkedContent: despots only embarrassed when their political maxims fail, not if they are revealed

KA.EP.content: international law: ein Wort ohne Sache > remainder of prudence not to force precipitately [Derrida], but approach steadily
KA.EP.linkedContent: international law: ein Wort ohne Sache > remainder of prudence not to force precipitately [Derrida], but approach steadily

KA.EP.content: freedom/equality > duty not prudence > political moralists: machinery

no objective conflict btwn morals & politics: only exists subjectively in selfish disposition of men > progress of culture allowing reason to execute ideas of natural law (but so also is guilt in such transgressions) > [but only theorists can say this?]
KA.EP.linkedContent: no objective conflict btwn morals & politics: only exists subjectively in selfish disposition of men > progress of culture allowing reason to execute ideas of natural law (but so also is guilt in such transgressions) > [but only theorists can say this?]

KA.EP.content: morals not empirical decisions need to cut Gordian knot btwn morals & politics > publicity in law
KA.EP.linkedContent: morals not empirical decisions need to cut Gordian knot btwn morals & politics > publicity in law
